elements.title: Melville Fuller
elements.contents: ... that U.S. Supreme Court Chief Justice Melville Fuller's mustache (pictured) was denounced as "deplorable" by the New York Sun, which claimed that it distracted lawyers and debased the court's dignity?

elements.title: Unearthed
elements.contents: ... that undercover journalists at the Greenpeace publication Unearthed tricked an ExxonMobil lobbyist into revealing the company's agenda by posing as job recruiters?

elements.title: Callimachus
elements.contents: ... that Callimachus wrote more than 800 books, but almost none of them have survived?

elements.title: A Beast the Color of Winter
elements.contents: ... that A Beast the Color of Winter describes the author, Douglas H. Chadwick, being gored by a mountain goat?

elements.title: Chico Velasquez
elements.contents: ... that Native American leader Chico Velasquez reputedly wore leggings decorated with the fingernails of his defeated enemies, American down one leg and Mexican down the other?

elements.title: Peace or Love
elements.contents: ... that Peace or Love (2021), the first album by the Norwegian duo Kings of Convenience in twelve years, was recorded five times?

elements.title: Ebba Atterbom
elements.contents: ... that Ebba Atterbom was the first person to translate the work of Irish novelist James Joyce into Swedish?

elements.title: Kake
elements.contents: ... that Kake has been described as "a sort of Johnny Appleseed ... spreading the seeds of liberated, mutually satisfying, ecstatically explicit gay sex"?
